page.title: 12SHALLOWFORD : WALTON MUSEUM
page.content: The museum at Shallowford is a cottage bequeathed by the angler Izaak Walton to his native Stafford in 1683. The museum's aim is to show a domestic interior such as Walton would have known. It is a timber-framed building with a tiled roof. The original thatched roof was destroyed by a fire started by a spark from a passing steam train in 1939. The museum houses stuffed fish of record sizes. Souvenirs connected with Izaak Walton and his book 'The Compleat Angler' are on sale. In 1983 the cottage featured on a special envelope commissioned by Staffordshire County Council for a series of Post Office stamps depicting British river fishes.
